Title: Hurst.VirtualKeyboard for WPF
Description: VirtualKeyboard is for use with WPF projects; it gives you a way to enable your users to enter characters in different languages and alphabets. Developed in C#.
HomeWiki:
Description

VirtualKeyboard is a virtual-keyboard for software developers to use with either desktop or onliine applications. This targets implementations that use WPF, and soon - Windows 8. With it - you now have a way to provide your users with the ability to enter characters in different languages and alphabets, or any Unicode character. Developed in C#, currently using Visual Studio 2013 and .NET 4.5.1, the downloads include earlier versions. If it is requested, I will maintain a separate versions for Visual Studio 2010 and Visual Studio 2008.

More information can be found on my blog article at: http://designforge.wordpress.com/2011/01/06/jhvirtualkeyboard/

See also the LogNut logging library at https://lognut.codeplex.com

by James W. Hurst
